p: To investigate whether Monarda essential oils elicited a transient increase in [Ca 2+] i exclusively through TRPA1 channels, we evaluated the specific TRPA1 antagonist HC-030031 [ 56] on the response to Monarda essential oils and found that the transient increases in [Ca 2+] i elicited via MEO Fl and MEO Lv were eliminated in HEK rTRPA1 cells when cells were pretreated with HC-030031 (20 ÂµM) for 20 min, and reversible inhibition was confirmed by a subsequent transient increase in [Ca 2+] i elicited by the essential oils following washout of HC-030031 from the perfusion chamber with the control buffer ( Figure 2). The Monarda essential oil-elicited transient increases in [Ca 2+] i pre- and post-HC-030031 treatments were of similar magnitude, further confirming the reversible antagonistic nature of HC-030031 inhibition.
